definitions.definition: To damage beyond use or repair ; to damage (something) to the point that it effectively ceases to exist.
examples: The earthquake destroyed several apartment complexes.

definitions.definition: To neutralize , undo a property or condition .
examples: Smoking destroys the natural subtlety of the palate.
Destroying a rabid dog is required by law.

definitions.definition: To severely disrupt the well-being of (a person); ruin .
examples: Her divorce destroyed her; she had a nervous breakdown and was severely depressed for more than a year.
Remember when Germany destroyed Brazil 7–1 in the World Cup?
The memory leak happened because we forgot to destroy the temporary lists.

definitions.definition: To exhaust completely and thus recreate or build up .
examples: This exercise is going to destroy all parts of your shoulders.

definitions.definition: To penetrate sexually in an aggressive way.
examples: She got destroyed by her lover on the carpet.

definitions.definition: To sing a song extremely poorly.
To eat food quickly , hungrily or completely .

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To damage beyond use or repair ; to damage (something) to the point that it effectively ceases to exist.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To neutralize , undo a property or condition .
( transitive ) To put down or euthanize .
( transitive ) To severely disrupt the well-being of (a person); ruin .
( transitive , informal ) To utterly defeat ; to crush .
( transitive , bodybuilding , slang , antiphrasis ) To exhaust completely and thus recreate or build up .
( transitive , slang , vulgar ) To penetrate sexually in an aggressive way.
( transitive , US , slang ) To sing a song extremely poorly.
( transitive , slang ) To eat food quickly , hungrily or completely .
